page.title: 01Introduction, Richmond area.
page.content: Standing as it does some 50 miles equidistant from{York, Leeds}and {Newcastle}, and only 3 miles from the A1, the area is well positioned. Within the area itself the contrasts are striking. On the one hand we have the magnificent sweep of the{R. Swale as it tumbles over the falls below the impressive walls of ancient{Richmond {Castle}, on the other the military starkness of the neatly laid-out barracks of{Catterick Garrison}.Then there are the lovely ruins of{Easby {Abbey}and the wooded slopes of the river valley. The land itself is rich and many crops are grown, including potatoes and cereals, but it is mainly good grazing land dotted with attractive woods containing a pleasing variety of trees. The main areas of population are{Richmond, Catterick {Garrison, Colburn}and{Hipswell. }
